intro: Asplenium radicans f. fusagasugensis, commonly known as the Fusagasugá spleenwort, is a rare fern species native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Aspleniaceae and is characterized by its compact, creeping growth habit with small, lanceolate leaves. The plant exhibits a unique morphological adaptation to its rocky, humid habitat, with specialized structures for water retention. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, which helps it withstand the cool, moist conditions of its environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
